title: Help a brother out. Will Alienware Alpha i3 suffice?

embed.description: Now featuring 6th Gen Intel® processors, the Alpha packs unexpected power in an ultra-small form factor. The rules of desktop gaming have changed. | Dell Australia

body:
Hey folks, was wondering if anyone could help out a fellow Summoner who is useless when it comes to understanding hardware.

6th Generation Intel® Core™ i3 Processor
4GB Memory
AMD Radeon™ R9 M470X GPU with 2 GB GDDR5


Will this run LoL at max settings and allow me to stream with at least 60FPS?

Thanks a tonne!


EDIT: Thanks for all the responses. Very helpful of you all.

replies.body:
i3 is pretty outdated tbh.

I run a Intel(R) core i5-3210m cpu @ 2.50 ghz

with 8gb memory


My league runs at 140 fps max setting and when streaming usually runs around 60-75 fps.

probably. but honestly amd is a garbage brand. do yourself a favour and get a nvidia gpu instead of an amd one. also try and build your own pc, it's much more cost efficient as alienware is pretty much a scam

> [{quoted}](name=Willi God,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nOvsjJEm,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-11-12T04:30:32.387+0000)
>
> lol nvidia fanboy spotted.

not true whatsoever. im a fanboy of making the objectively correct decision

Fans and bias aside, nvidia generally has better post purchase support for their products. That alone would be enough for me to buy nvidia over amd assuming the price is comparable for any given product.

I think the i3 is a little outdated and I've heard terrible things about Radeon gpu's, like said above you're better off building your own pc it may seem pricey but in the long run it will save you a tonne and also gives you the opportunity to upgrade as you go, I've recently upgraded to 16g ram and I tell you I will never go back, my gpu and CPU is running everything I play on ultra at max fps without overclock and I love it
Pretty much anything Alienware is good enough. The extra $2k they usually charge is because it's good...

Now running LoL at 60 fps max settings is absolutely piss ease, a 750 ti will do it, and so will an rx 460.

For streaming though generally you want a semi decent cpu so something in the i5 range.

That PC also only has 4GB ram as default which is horrible, no PC built today should have less than 8.

https://www.pccasegear.com/products/37177/pccg-predator-470-gaming-system-black Here is a far better option, also that 470 that alienware for PC has is a mobile version, i far less powerful version than the desktop version, that's what the M stands for. I have no idea why they've put that in there. DON'T BUY THIS ALIENWARE PC.
